topic.title: AMI Settings
topic.shortdesc: The Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI) is a system monitoring and management interface provided by Asterisk. It allows live monitoring of events that occur in the system, as well enabling you to request that Asterisk perform some action.

div.p: The actions that are available are wide-ranging and include things such as returning status information and originating new calls.
Many interesting applications have been developed on top of Asterisk that take advantage of the AMI as their primary interface to Asterisk.

Main types of messages:
manager events
manager actions

body.p: The 3rd party software can work with TA1600/2400/3200 using AMI interface. It is disabled by default. If necessary, you can enable it.

li.p: After enabling AMI, you can use this username and password to log in to TA1600/2400/3200. The default port is 5038.
You can set which IP is allowed to log in to TA1600/2400/3200 AMI interface.
